Package com.rapidminer.belt.buffer

Class CategoricalBufferSparse<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.belt.buffer.CategoricalBufferSparse<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Int32CategoricalBufferSparse, UInt16CategoricalBufferSparse, UInt8CategoricalBufferSparse
    public abstract class CategoricalBufferSparse<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Temporary random access buffer that can be used to define a CategoricalColumn. The buffer is write only. The #setNext(T) method can be used to set the next free index in the buffer to the given value. The #setNext(int, T) method can be used to set a specific position to the given value. In this case all values at smaller indices (that have not already been set) will be set to the buffer's default value. This is more efficient than calling #setNext(T) for every default value. Please note that values, once they are set, cannot be modified.

    Please note that the buffer implementation is thread safe but accessing it from multiple threads will be slow.

    The buffer's efficiency will depend on the data's sparsity and number of different categories. The buffer will usually be memory and time efficient for

  • > 65535 categories (32 bit data) and a sparsity of >= 50%.
  • > 255 and <= 65535 categories (16 bit data) and a sparsity of >= 66%.
  • <= 255 categories (8 bit data) and a sparsity of >= 80%.

    The sparse buffer comes with a constant memory overhead so that it is recommended not to use it for very small data (<1024 data points).

Author:
Kevin Majchrzak

    • Method Detail

      • setNext

        public abstract void setNext​(T value)
        Sets the value at the next index to the given value.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If attempting to add more than size() values.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the buffer is frozen (see toColumn(ColumnType)).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If attempting to add more than the maximum number of different categories determined by the buffer's indexFormat().

      • setNext

        public abstract void setNext​(int index,
                             T value)
        Sets the value at the given index to the given value. All indices {<=} the given index that have not been set so far will be set to the default value. Please note that you cannot modify an index smaller than or equal to the given index after calling this method. Trying to access an index <= the largest index that has already been set will lead to an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        index - an index inside of the buffers bounds (0 inclusive to size() exclusive) at which to set the value.
        value - the value to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if index is <= the largest index that has already been set

        or if attempting to add more than the maximum number of different categories determined by the buffer's indexFormat().

        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified index is outside of the buffer's bounds.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the buffer is read-only (see toColumn(ColumnType)).

      • setNextSave

        public abstract boolean setNextSave​(int index,
                                    T value)
        Tries to set the data at the given index to the given value. Returns true if it worked and false if the buffer format cannot hold any more different values. All indices {<=} the given index that have not been set so far will be set to the default value. Please note that you cannot modify an index smaller than or equal to the given index after calling this method. Trying to access an index <= the largest index that has already been set will lead to an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        index - the index where the value should be set
        value - the value to set
        Returns:
        false if the buffer contained already to many different values to take this value, true otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the buffer is read-only (see toColumn(ColumnType)).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if index is <= the largest index that has already been set

        or if attempting to add more than the maximum number of different categories determined by the buffer's indexFormat().

        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified index is outside of the buffer's bounds.

      • differentValues

        public abstract int differentValues()
        Returns the number of different values that were fed into this buffer. null values are not counted.
        Returns:
        the number of different values

      • indexFormat

        public abstract IntegerFormats.Format indexFormat()
        Returns:
        the category index format of the buffer determining the maximal number of categories

      • size

        public abstract int size()
        Returns the buffer's overall size (not the number of elements currently inside the buffer).
        Returns:
        the buffers size.

      • toColumn

        public abstract CategoricalColumn<T> toColumn​(ColumnType<T> type)
        Returns a column of the given type using the buffer's data. The buffer becomes read-only. In contrast to constructing a new buffer from a column this method does not copy the data.
        Parameters:
        type - the column type (must be categorical)
        Returns:
        the categorical column
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given ColumnType is not categorical.

      • toBooleanColumn

        public abstract CategoricalColumn<T> toBooleanColumn​(ColumnType<T> type,
                                                     T positiveValue)
        Creates a boolean column with the given positive value if the dictionary has at most two values. The positive value must be either one of the dictionary values, making the other value, if it exists, negative. Or in case of a dictionary with only one value the positive value can be null making the only value negative.
        Parameters:
        type - the column type (must be categorical)
        positiveValue - the positive value or null
        Returns:
        a categorical column with a boolean Dictionary
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given positive value is not one of the values, if there are more than two values in the dictionary or if positive value is null in case there are two values in the dictionary
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given ColumnType is not categorical.
